title: List of Commands
description: A list of frequently-used commands for each Sourcegraph deployment type.

Get Logs.description: Get the logs of a container.

Install or Start Sourcegraph.description: The docker run command first creates a writeable container layer over the specified image, and then starts it using the specified command.

Upgrade Sourcegraph.description: All you need to do to upgrade Sourcegraph is to restart your Docker server with a new image tag.

Run Bash Shell.description: This allows you to execute an interactive bash shell on a running container.

Run Interactive Shell.description: This allows you to execute an interactive shell on a running container.

Get Logs.description: Get the logs of a container.

Start Sourcegraph.description: Builds, (re)creates, starts, and attaches to containers for Sourcegraph. `-d` flag starts the container in the detached mode where the container runs in the background.

Shutdown Sourcegraph.description: Stops containers and removes containers, networks, volumes, and images created by docker up.

Run Bash Shell.description: This allows you to execute an interactive bash shell on a running container.

Access pgsql database.description: This allows you to access the main database and run psql commands on a running container.

Access codeintel database.description: This allows you to access codeintel database and run psql commands on a running container.

Generate the database dumps.command: docker exec pgsql sh -c 'pg_dump -C --username sg sg' > sourcegraph_db.out
Generate the database dumps.description: This allows you to generate the database dumps for the main database. Replace pgsql to codeintel-db for codeintel-db.

Get Logs.description: Get the logs of a specified pod.

List Pods.description: Get a list of pods within the cluster and their health status.

Describe Pod.description: Display detailed information about the status of a single pod

Restart Sourcegraph.description: Restart Sourcegraph Instance by restarting the frontend pod.

Get Events.description: List all events in the clusterâ€™s history.

Delete a Pod.description: Delete a failing pod so that it will get recreated, possibly on a different node.

List Persistent Volume Claims (PVCs).description: List all Persistent Volume Claims (PVCs) and their statuses.

List Persistent Volumes (PVs).description: List all Persistent Volumes (PVs) that have been provisioned.

Port Forward Sourcegraph Frontend.description: This allows you to access your deployed Sourcegraph instance locally.

Run Interactive Shell.description: This allows you to execute an interactive shell on a Pod.

Check Dirty Database.description: Get inside the PGSQL Pod to check for dirty database.

Generate Postgres Database Dump.description: This allows you to generate a database dump for Postgres.

Generate Code Intel Database Dump.description: This allows you to generate a database dump for the Code Intel service.

Stop existing deployment.description: Stop the existing deployment by removing the frontend.

Show pod metrics.description: This allows you to show metrics for a given pod and it's containers.

Check Storage Class.description: This allows you to check the existence of a storage class and it's name.
